feed.title: Digital Transformation in Education
feed.subtitle: Digital Transformation is a strategy being used by industry to solve problems with smart, connected technologies. PTC Education works to bring these industry ready technologies to researchers and teachers around the world.

entry.title: DX in Education Summit
entry.content:
PTC Education hosted the Digital Transformation in Education Summit on May 19th!

Click here to see the full agenda for the event, and see below for links to all of the posters shared during the student poster session.



Digital Miniature Factory - Jürgen Altenriederer, UAS Technikum Wien

Onshape CAD Analytics: A Gold Mine for Studying CAD Designer Behavior - James Chen, UToronto

Some (Team) Assembly Required: An Analysis of Collaborative Computer-Aided Design Assembly - Kathy Cheng, UToronto

Smart Motors: Trainable Motors for Story Telling: Milan Dahal, Tufts

Analysis of a Closed-Loop Digital Twin - Andrew Eyring, BYU

A User-Friendly Digital Twin Package for UR Collaborative Robots - JT Frandsen, BYU

Implementing Virtual Twins for Robotics Design - Owen Gervais & Therese Patrosio, Tufts

AR for Advanced Learning - Ethan Gunn, BYU

Augmented Reality Instruction for the Machine Shop - Emma Higgason & Gabrielle Enns, MIT

Smart Factory Testbed - Nathan Hoyt, BYU

Identifying Computer-Aided Design Action Types from Professional User Analytics Data - Kevin Leonardo, UToronto

Augmented Reality in the Field of Nanotechnology Education - Megan Ngo & Tema Nwana, MIT

Introducing Reinforcement Learning to K-12 Students with AR and LEGO Robot - Ziyi Zhang, Tufts
entry.summary: PTC Education hosted the Digital Transformation in Education Summit on May 19th! Click here to see the full agenda for the event, and see below for links to all of the posters shared during the student poster session. Digital Miniature Factory - Jürgen Altenriederer, UAS Technikum Wien
